summary: Arya looks like Lyanna,  Dany looks like Rhaegar. So we need an AU where Arya wins a tourney and crowns Dany her queen of love...
body:
Arya looks like Lyanna,  Dany looks like Rhaegar.

So we need an AU where Arya wins a tourney and crowns Dany her queen of love and beauty. Because if Arya had a girl crush on anybody that would be Daenerys (and visa versa).

tags: today is clean out my drafts day
summary: Arya could not believe what she was seeing. She hated Hot Pie! Why would he risk himself for her?…Arya wouldn’t let them die for...
body:
Arya could not believe what she was seeing. She hated Hot Pie! Why would he risk himself for her?…Arya wouldn’t let them die for her like Syrio. She wouldn’t! Shoving through the hedge with Needle in hand, she slid into a water dancer’s stance.

The officer looked her up and down. “Put the blade away, little girl, no one wants to hurt you.”

“I’m not a girl!” she yelled, furious. What was wrong with them? They rode all this way for her and here she was and they were just smiling at her. “I’m the one you want.”

too much “arya couldn’t have survived kings landing” talk

instead we should talk about how arya was willing to sacrifice herself to protect the night’s watch recruits who were at best strangers and at worst bullied her. in kings landing arya understood what a threat the lannisters were and that they could imprison and/or kill her but in this moment she tried to surrender herself to them because she didnt want anyone else dying. even if it was someone like hot pie who tried to hurt her.

arya is so compassionate and protective and brave

“I’m not a girl!” she yelled, furious. What was wrong with them? They rode all this way for her and here she was and they were just smiling at her. “I’m the one you want.”

summary: “Leave him be,” said the boy with the shaggy black hair who rode behind them. Lommy had named him the Bull, on account of this...
text: “Leave him be,” said the boy with the shaggy black hair who rode behind them. Lommy had named him the Bull, on account of this horned helm he had that he polished all the time but never wore. Lommy didn’t dare mock the Bull. He was older, and big for his age, with a broad chest and strong-looking arms. […] The Bull shouted, “Behind you,” and Arya spun.

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Day Eleven  Gendry and Arya build a gingerbread house in a competition against Jon and Robb.[[MORE]] To say Arya was confused...
caption:
Day Eleven

Gendry and Arya build a gingerbread house in a competition against Jon and Robb.

To say Arya was confused was an understatement. Gendry had texted her last night and told her she needed to come to his apartment tonight by six o’clock. So here she was sitting in her car outside Gendry, Jon, and Robb’s apartment five blocks from the Stormland’s campus. Where she would hopefully be attending next year. Her brothers and Gendry were all juniors this year. Although both her brothers were planning on going to graduate school in the next few years.

She had yet to go inside because their car was not parked outside. She wondered what the hell was going on. After another five minutes another car pulled into the parking lot and their unmistakable forms emerged, and they looked to be carrying boxes. Decently sized boxes at that. Wasting no time Arya turned off her engine and climbed out of her small car, closing the door behind her with a small thud. The walk to their second story apartment wasn’t a long one, but it was quite a cold night and she had all she could not to run up the stairs. She had better balance than most men, but she was convinced that even she would fall on the ice. When she reached the door she knocked on it loudly. Jon opened it almost immediately. He must’ve still been standing in the entryway. He picked her up in a tight hug and carried her inside. He set her down on the tile floor and waited for her to remove her boots before he walked into the kitchen. Arya followed shortly after hanging her coat up and placing her gloves and hat on the radiator. She was wearing her favorite Night’s Watch t-shirt that Jon had gotten her when he went to their concert a few years back, somehow she hadn’t managed to rip it yet.

Their kitchen wasn’t very large but it had an island the looked into the living room, Arya thought it was an attempt to make the small space seem bigger. On the  island were the two large boxes she saw them with earlier as well as a few bags of pretzels and various candies. Arya’s eye lit up immediately, she saw Jon and Robb smirk. Gendry on the other hand stood there confused, typical bull.

“Can someone explain to me why Arya and you two turned into a pack of hungry wolves?” Gendry asked, his hands still resting on top of one of the gingerbread houses he pulled from a paper bag. His eyes locked on Arya’s and it felt like they were piercing into her soul. They were those breathtaking blue eyes that haunted her dreams at night. Those blue eyes that belonged to a man she could never call her’s. She had put her pride aside before and asked him to her homecoming dance, but he had rejected her. Although he did it the nicest way he knew how, Arya understood his message loud and clear. She was and forever will be Arya horseface. She should have known Gendry wouldn’t like her. With the number of girls that were always fawning over him why would he choose her? Why would he when there were people like Sansa? Your typical beautiful girl who swoons over you and won’t challenge your masculinity. Arya hadn’t tried to seek out a romantic partner since the incident with Gendry and most boys weren’t interested in her. Many men had told her that she acted to much like a boy to ever have anyone want her that way. She was done with society’s sexist rules and how women were treated as dainty and unworthy. She didn’t need a man to make her happy, but she wondered how having one would make her feel… Would she feel different if she had someone in her life that treated her differently?

“Arya?” She heard as she snapped out of her daze, “You okay over there?”

She nodded her head and walked over to the counter where the items laid out. “Well, I know exactly what’s happening here.” Gendry still looked confused, of course. “Isn’t it obvious? We’re having a gingerbread house competition!”

“Why’d we only get two gingerbread houses then?” Gendry questioned.

“Our family only plays in teams. So we’re having a face off. So, I want J-”

“Robb and I have already decided that we’re going to be a team.” Jon interrupted his sister. She looked furious, but then an evil glint shown in her eyes.

“You’re going to regret that.” Arya pointed a finger at her favorite sibling. She turned to Gendry and poked a finger into his chest, ignoring the excitement she felt when it hit nothing but muscle. “I hope you’re ready.”

They stood there staring at into each other’s eyes for a moment ignoring the knowing stares from both of Arya’s brothers. After who knows how long of grey staring down blue, Robb coughed and broke them out of their daze. Neither had known that Gendry had grabbed Arya’s hand that moved from poking his chest to gently resting there.

“We’re going to crush you.” Arya said annoyed. Gendry’s hand had moved to rest on her lower back in a comforting manner, unbeknownst to Robb and Jon. Arya forced the red off of her cheeks, ducking her head so no one could see her blushing.

“Well, let’s get to it then!” Robb said clapping his hands together. Jon laughed and grabbed one of the boxes. He brought it to the other end of the counter and unfolded the cardboard box so there was a large base to build their house on. Arya immediately did the same. She motioned for Gendry to grab a bag of pretzels and a few bags of various candies. She began by massaging the bag of frosting, ignoring the way Gendry’s eyes followed her hands as they softened the bag of buttercream. It took him a moment before he grabbed a few pieces on gingerbread and helped Arya to begin stacking them accordingly. She was planning on building a castle, not Winterfell, the castle her family held back in the days of the first men, but a typical one you would see in the storybooks. Her and Gendry peaked across the counter and saw that Jon and Robb were building what looked to be a log cabin. She smiled and continued to work on their modest castle. Gendry was working on building a forest made from ice cream cones on the other side of their piece of cardboard. Arya had to admit that she was impressed at his work for someone who had never built a gingerbread house before.

“What do you two think?” Jon asked, “Let’s say thirty minutes left?” Everyone agreed that that should be more than enough time to finish their masterpieces. Arya and Gendry were putting the last touches on their roof while Robb and Jon added ice cycles to their cabin.

“Time!” Robb called out much louder than he needed to. Arya jumped and was caught by a pair of strong arms. Gendry was holding her to his chest. She could feel every inch of his body where they were connected. One hand was resting on the skin exposed at her hip where her shirt had rode up. His hand felt like it was on fire, not that he would ever say that out loud for her to hear. He had turned her down once, much to his dismay, but he knew that if he had said yes that both Robb and Jon would gut him like a fish. Arya was their baby sister and no man would ever be good enough for her, no matter if it were himself or the crowned prince. So all those feelings he had for her for the past few years he pushed aside. His relationship with Arya had been strained since he turned down her proposal of going to her homecoming dance. He wished with all his being that he had said yes when he saw her that night before she left. She had been wearing a tight and too short black dress and her hair was down in loose waves around her face. Gendry had never seen anything so beautiful and he wanted to tell her so, but it took her months to even talk to him again and seven hells if he was going to lose her again.

Gendry leaned in close and whispered in Arya’s ear, his mouth accidentally touching the soft skin of her earlobe. “For what it’s worth, I think we won.”

Arya shivered as a chill made its way from her neck to her toes. She relaxed and felt her body rest even more on Gendry, allowing him to hold almost all of her body weight. She rested her hand on his that was still pressed into her hip before she allowed herself to stand freely on her own two feet. Robb and Jon were still focused on their own gingerbread house to notice the exchange between their youngest sister and their friend.

“I’ll admit it, you did a good job.” Arya said moving to stand between her brothers. Jon wrapped his arm around her shoulder as Robb slapped Gendry on the back.

“Aye, it turned out really well, but I think you and Gendry might have outdone us this time. We’ll get you next year though.” Arya chuckled at that, Robb nodded in agreement. “Now if you excuse us, Robb and I have dates tonight.”

“I guess that means I should get going then.” Arya started to move to gather her things.

“Wait, why?” Robb asked confused. “We thought you’d stay here with Gendry.”

“Uh, why would you think that?” Gendry questioned, Robb’s grip on his shoulder tightened.

“For starters, everyone knows you fancy each other. We figured that you’d have both gotten together by now, but seven hells, you two are moving agonizingly slow and everyone thinks that you need a push. So, here it is, a push.” Robb stated, Jon stood next to him now nodding his head in agreement.

“Are you two out of your minds?” Arya bellowed, her head going into her hands embarrassed. She felt two hands on her wrists, but she moved to pull away. Their grip remained unmoving, not allowing her to get away. She heard some shuffling and then a door shutting loudly

“Arya, open your eyes and look at me please.” Gendry pleaded. Arya lifted her face and looked him in the eyes. “I know I messed up once, but I swear it’s only because I thought myself unworthy. Well, that and I thought your brothers would kill me and wide my body in a ditch somewhere in the Stormlands. But I’m here now and everyone has made it clear that I can finally act on my feelings for you. Arya, please, tell me now if you still feel the way you did when you asked me to your homecoming dance. If you no longer feel that way towards me I understand, but I need to tell you how I truly feel.”

The younger girl looked up at him and when he moved to speak again, Arya leapt up and threw her arms around his neck. His head was buried in her neck, Arya’s hand grabbing at the hair at the nape of his neck. Gendry pulled back and looked into Arya’s eye for a moment before leaning in tentatively. When his lips met hers it felt like pure bliss. They moved slowly at first, exploring each other’s mouths with pure curiosity that spanned over years and years. Their innocent kiss deepened quickly. Their tongues fighting each other with passion. Gendry lifted Arya up and moved to set her on the counter, accidentally sending Jon and Robb’s gingerbread castle to the tiled floor below.

“Shit!” He yelled and pulled away from Arya. She laughed at how his hair stuck up in different directions. He turned and looked at her like she were mad.

“I guess that’s one way to ensure we win the gingerbread contest.” Gendry rested his forehead on hers as a small huff of laughter escaped him. He could get used to this.
caption_abstract:
Day Eleven

Gendry and Arya build a gingerbread house in a competition against Jon and Robb.

reblog.comment:

“Are you two out of your minds?” Arya bellowed, her head going into her hands embarrassed. She felt two hands on her wrists, but she moved to pull away. Their grip remained unmoving, not allowing her to get away. She heard some shuffling and then a door shutting loudly

“Arya, open your eyes and look at me please.” Gendry pleaded. Arya lifted her face and looked him in the eyes. “I know I messed up once, but I swear it’s only because I thought myself unworthy. Well, that and I thought your brothers would kill me and wide my body in a ditch somewhere in the Stormlands. But I’m here now and everyone has made it clear that I can finally act on my feelings for you. Arya, please, tell me now if you still feel the way you did when you asked me to your homecoming dance. If you no longer feel that way towards me I understand, but I need to tell you how I truly feel.”

The younger girl looked up at him and when he moved to speak again, Arya leapt up and threw her arms around his neck. His head was buried in her neck, Arya’s hand grabbing at the hair at the nape of his neck. Gendry pulled back and looked into Arya’s eye for a moment before leaning in tentatively. When his lips met hers it felt like pure bliss. They moved slowly at first, exploring each other’s mouths with pure curiosity that spanned over years and years. Their innocent kiss deepened quickly. Their tongues fighting each other with passion. Gendry lifted Arya up and moved to set her on the counter, accidentally sending Jon and Robb’s gingerbread castle to the tiled floor below.

“Shit!” He yelled and pulled away from Arya. She laughed at how his hair stuck up in different directions. He turned and looked at her like she were mad.

“I guess that’s one way to ensure we win the gingerbread contest.” Gendry rested his forehead on hers as a small huff of laughter escaped him. He could get used to this.

trail.content_raw:
Day Eleven

Gendry and Arya build a gingerbread house in a competition against Jon and Robb.

[[MORE]]

To say Arya was confused was an understatement. Gendry had texted her last night and told her she needed to come to his apartment tonight by six o’clock. So here she was sitting in her car outside Gendry, Jon, and Robb’s apartment five blocks from the Stormland’s campus. Where she would hopefully be attending next year. Her brothers and Gendry were all juniors this year. Although both her brothers were planning on going to graduate school in the next few years.

She had yet to go inside because their car was not parked outside. She wondered what the hell was going on. After another five minutes another car pulled into the parking lot and their unmistakable forms emerged, and they looked to be carrying boxes. Decently sized boxes at that. Wasting no time Arya turned off her engine and climbed out of her small car, closing the door behind her with a small thud. The walk to their second story apartment wasn’t a long one, but it was quite a cold night and she had all she could not to run up the stairs. She had better balance than most men, but she was convinced that even she would fall on the ice. When she reached the door she knocked on it loudly. Jon opened it almost immediately. He must’ve still been standing in the entryway. He picked her up in a tight hug and carried her inside. He set her down on the tile floor and waited for her to remove her boots before he walked into the kitchen. Arya followed shortly after hanging her coat up and placing her gloves and hat on the radiator. She was wearing her favorite Night’s Watch t-shirt that Jon had gotten her when he went to their concert a few years back, somehow she hadn’t managed to rip it yet.

Their kitchen wasn’t very large but it had an island the looked into the living room, Arya thought it was an attempt to make the small space seem bigger. On the  island were the two large boxes she saw them with earlier as well as a few bags of pretzels and various candies. Arya’s eye lit up immediately, she saw Jon and Robb smirk. Gendry on the other hand stood there confused, typical bull.

“Can someone explain to me why Arya and you two turned into a pack of hungry wolves?” Gendry asked, his hands still resting on top of one of the gingerbread houses he pulled from a paper bag. His eyes locked on Arya’s and it felt like they were piercing into her soul. They were those breathtaking blue eyes that haunted her dreams at night. Those blue eyes that belonged to a man she could never call her’s. She had put her pride aside before and asked him to her homecoming dance, but he had rejected her. Although he did it the nicest way he knew how, Arya understood his message loud and clear. She was and forever will be Arya horseface. She should have known Gendry wouldn’t like her. With the number of girls that were always fawning over him why would he choose her? Why would he when there were people like Sansa? Your typical beautiful girl who swoons over you and won’t challenge your masculinity. Arya hadn’t tried to seek out a romantic partner since the incident with Gendry and most boys weren’t interested in her. Many men had told her that she acted to much like a boy to ever have anyone want her that way. She was done with society’s sexist rules and how women were treated as dainty and unworthy. She didn’t need a man to make her happy, but she wondered how having one would make her feel… Would she feel different if she had someone in her life that treated her differently?

“Arya?” She heard as she snapped out of her daze, “You okay over there?”

She nodded her head and walked over to the counter where the items laid out. “Well, I know exactly what’s happening here.” Gendry still looked confused, of course. “Isn’t it obvious? We’re having a gingerbread house competition!”

“Why’d we only get two gingerbread houses then?” Gendry questioned.

“Our family only plays in teams. So we’re having a face off. So, I want J-”

“Robb and I have already decided that we’re going to be a team.” Jon interrupted his sister. She looked furious, but then an evil glint shown in her eyes.

“You’re going to regret that.” Arya pointed a finger at her favorite sibling. She turned to Gendry and poked a finger into his chest, ignoring the excitement she felt when it hit nothing but muscle. “I hope you’re ready.”

They stood there staring at into each other’s eyes for a moment ignoring the knowing stares from both of Arya’s brothers. After who knows how long of grey staring down blue, Robb coughed and broke them out of their daze. Neither had known that Gendry had grabbed Arya’s hand that moved from poking his chest to gently resting there.

“We’re going to crush you.” Arya said annoyed. Gendry’s hand had moved to rest on her lower back in a comforting manner, unbeknownst to Robb and Jon. Arya forced the red off of her cheeks, ducking her head so no one could see her blushing.

“Well, let’s get to it then!” Robb said clapping his hands together. Jon laughed and grabbed one of the boxes. He brought it to the other end of the counter and unfolded the cardboard box so there was a large base to build their house on. Arya immediately did the same. She motioned for Gendry to grab a bag of pretzels and a few bags of various candies. She began by massaging the bag of frosting, ignoring the way Gendry’s eyes followed her hands as they softened the bag of buttercream. It took him a moment before he grabbed a few pieces on gingerbread and helped Arya to begin stacking them accordingly. She was planning on building a castle, not Winterfell, the castle her family held back in the days of the first men, but a typical one you would see in the storybooks. Her and Gendry peaked across the counter and saw that Jon and Robb were building what looked to be a log cabin. She smiled and continued to work on their modest castle. Gendry was working on building a forest made from ice cream cones on the other side of their piece of cardboard. Arya had to admit that she was impressed at his work for someone who had never built a gingerbread house before.

“What do you two think?” Jon asked, “Let’s say thirty minutes left?” Everyone agreed that that should be more than enough time to finish their masterpieces. Arya and Gendry were putting the last touches on their roof while Robb and Jon added ice cycles to their cabin.

“Time!” Robb called out much louder than he needed to. Arya jumped and was caught by a pair of strong arms. Gendry was holding her to his chest. She could feel every inch of his body where they were connected. One hand was resting on the skin exposed at her hip where her shirt had rode up. His hand felt like it was on fire, not that he would ever say that out loud for her to hear. He had turned her down once, much to his dismay, but he knew that if he had said yes that both Robb and Jon would gut him like a fish. Arya was their baby sister and no man would ever be good enough for her, no matter if it were himself or the crowned prince. So all those feelings he had for her for the past few years he pushed aside. His relationship with Arya had been strained since he turned down her proposal of going to her homecoming dance. He wished with all his being that he had said yes when he saw her that night before she left. She had been wearing a tight and too short black dress and her hair was down in loose waves around her face. Gendry had never seen anything so beautiful and he wanted to tell her so, but it took her months to even talk to him again and seven hells if he was going to lose her again.

Gendry leaned in close and whispered in Arya’s ear, his mouth accidentally touching the soft skin of her earlobe. “For what it’s worth, I think we won.”

Arya shivered as a chill made its way from her neck to her toes. She relaxed and felt her body rest even more on Gendry, allowing him to hold almost all of her body weight. She rested her hand on his that was still pressed into her hip before she allowed herself to stand freely on her own two feet. Robb and Jon were still focused on their own gingerbread house to notice the exchange between their youngest sister and their friend.

“I’ll admit it, you did a good job.” Arya said moving to stand between her brothers. Jon wrapped his arm around her shoulder as Robb slapped Gendry on the back.

“Aye, it turned out really well, but I think you and Gendry might have outdone us this time. We’ll get you next year though.” Arya chuckled at that, Robb nodded in agreement. “Now if you excuse us, Robb and I have dates tonight.”

“I guess that means I should get going then.” Arya started to move to gather her things.

“Wait, why?” Robb asked confused. “We thought you’d stay here with Gendry.”

“Uh, why would you think that?” Gendry questioned, Robb’s grip on his shoulder tightened.

“For starters, everyone knows you fancy each other. We figured that you’d have both gotten together by now, but seven hells, you two are moving agonizingly slow and everyone thinks that you need a push. So, here it is, a push.” Robb stated, Jon stood next to him now nodding his head in agreement.

“Are you two out of your minds?” Arya bellowed, her head going into her hands embarrassed. She felt two hands on her wrists, but she moved to pull away. Their grip remained unmoving, not allowing her to get away. She heard some shuffling and then a door shutting loudly

“Arya, open your eyes and look at me please.” Gendry pleaded. Arya lifted her face and looked him in the eyes. “I know I messed up once, but I swear it’s only because I thought myself unworthy. Well, that and I thought your brothers would kill me and wide my body in a ditch somewhere in the Stormlands. But I’m here now and everyone has made it clear that I can finally act on my feelings for you. Arya, please, tell me now if you still feel the way you did when you asked me to your homecoming dance. If you no longer feel that way towards me I understand, but I need to tell you how I truly feel.”

The younger girl looked up at him and when he moved to speak again, Arya leapt up and threw her arms around his neck. His head was buried in her neck, Arya’s hand grabbing at the hair at the nape of his neck. Gendry pulled back and looked into Arya’s eye for a moment before leaning in tentatively. When his lips met hers it felt like pure bliss. They moved slowly at first, exploring each other’s mouths with pure curiosity that spanned over years and years. Their innocent kiss deepened quickly. Their tongues fighting each other with passion. Gendry lifted Arya up and moved to set her on the counter, accidentally sending Jon and Robb’s gingerbread castle to the tiled floor below.

“Shit!” He yelled and pulled away from Arya. She laughed at how his hair stuck up in different directions. He turned and looked at her like she were mad.

“I guess that’s one way to ensure we win the gingerbread contest.” Gendry rested his forehead on hers as a small huff of laughter escaped him. He could get used to this.

trail.content_abstract:
Day Eleven

Gendry and Arya build a gingerbread house in a competition against Jon and Robb.

blog.name: gendrie
blog.title: fierce and terrible and hers
blog.description:
annalesa / 27 / pisces /
they would not make her yield

summary: "Didn't you ever have a brother you wanted to kill?" He laughed again. "Or maybe a sister?" He must have seen something in her...
caption:
“Didn’t you ever have a brother you wanted to kill?” He laughed again. “Or maybe a sister?” He must have seen something in her face then, for he leaned closer. “Sansa. That’s it, isn’t it? The wolf bitch wants to kill the pretty bird.”

“No,” Arya spat back at him. “I’d like to kill you."

reblog.comment:

“No,” Arya spat back at him. “I’d like to kill you."

blog.name: asoiafhistory
blog.title: ASOIAFHISTORY
blog.description: This blog is dedicated to the series books A Song Of Ice and Fire written by George R. R. Martin.

summary:
asoiaf meme ♦ scenes (2/?) ⟶ the meaning of the Needle Needle was too small to be a proper sword, it was
hardly more than a toy....
caption:
asoiaf meme ♦ scenes (2/?) ⟶ the meaning of the Needle

Needle was too small to be a proper sword, it was hardly more than a toy. She’d been a stupid little girl when Jon had it made for her. “It’s just a sword,” she said, aloud this time…
 … but it wasn’t. 
Needle was Robb and Bran and Rickon, her mother and her father, even Sansa. Needle was Winterfell’s grey walls, and the laughter of its people. Needle was the summer snows, Old Nan’s stories, the heart tree with its red leaves and scary face, the warm earthy smell of the glass gardens, the sound of the north wind rattling the shutters of her room. Needle was Jon Snow’s smile. He used to mess my hair and call me “little sister,” she remembered, and suddenly there were tears in her eyes

                                                                                           ⚔

The gods wanted me to have it. Not the Seven, nor Him of Many Faces, but her father’s gods, the old gods of the north. The Many-Faced God can have the rest, she thought, but he can’t have this

summary: Arya: Look, when it started I was just trying to be nice to him because he was my sister's boyfriend. And then, one thing led to...
body:
Arya: Look, when it started I was just trying to be nice to him because he was my sister's boyfriend. And then, one thing led to another and, before I knew it, we were...killing Cersei together.
Jaqen: Oh. Oh, my Red God. 
Arya: Honey, wait. We only did it once. It didn't mean anything to me.
Jaqen: Yeah, right. Sure!
Arya: Really, Jaqen, I was thinking of you the whole time. Look, I'm sorry, all right. I never meant for you to find out!

dialogue.name: Arya
dialogue.label: Arya:

summary: Sandor: Oh, listen Arya. I have this business with Gregor in King's Landing and Cersei's still there. So, you want to come with...
body:
Sandor: Oh, listen Arya. I have this business with Gregor in King's Landing and Cersei's still there. So, you want to come with me and take advantage of it?
Arya: Seven hells, I’ll go with you !
Sansa: Arya what’re you doin’? You can’t go killing with Sandor? What about Jaqen?
Arya: It’s gonna be a problem, isn’t it?
Hot Pie: Come on, you’re going to kill Cersei with Sandor? That’s like cheating on Jaqen in his house of worship.

summary: Ya’ll remember when Arya and Gendry screamed ‘kill him’ at Beric who was fighting against the Hound. Now imagine Cleganebowl in...
body: Ya’ll remember when Arya and Gendry screamed ‘kill him’ at Beric who was fighting against the Hound. Now imagine Cleganebowl in s8 and this time Arya and Gendry scream ‘kill him’ at the Hound who’s fighting the Mountain. Poetic cinema tbh.

reblog.comment: Ya’ll remember when Arya and Gendry screamed ‘kill him’ at Beric who was fighting against the Hound. Now imagine Cleganebowl in s8 and this time Arya and Gendry scream ‘kill him’ at the Hound who’s fighting the Mountain. Poetic cinema tbh.
